title: Empathy Ledger Integration: Amplifying Voices, Respecting Sovereignty

the_integration.headline: Community Stories on Community Terms
the_integration.description: Empathy Ledger is a multi-tenant cultural storytelling platform that puts control in the hands of storytellers. JusticeHub's integration amplifies these voices to a wider audience‚Äîbut only when storytellers explicitly consent. This isn't aggregation. It's respectful syndication.
the_integration.key_differentiator: Unlike platforms that harvest content, Empathy Ledger stories only appear on JusticeHub when the storyteller has actively chosen to share publicly. The power stays with the community.

consent_model.headline: Three-Tier Consent: You Control Your Story

tiers.meaning: Only visible to the storyteller and authorized organization staff
tiers.justicehub: Never synced. Never visible. Full privacy.

tiers.meaning: Shared within the storyteller's organization or community
tiers.justicehub: Not exposed publicly. Stays within your circle.
Can appear on JusticeHub with full attribution

key_points: Consent is active, not passive‚Äîyou must opt in to each level
You can change your consent at any time
Deleting or changing privacy removes content from JusticeHub

features.name: Elder Approval Workflow
features.description: For content that requires Elder guidance, stories can be flagged for approval before public sharing. Stories won't appear on JusticeHub until an Elder has reviewed and approved.

features.name: Cultural Warnings
features.description: Storytellers can add warnings that display before content‚Äîfor culturally sensitive material, content mentioning deceased persons, or sacred knowledge.

features.name: Cultural Sensitivity Levels
features.description: Content is tagged with sensitivity levels to help readers understand the nature of what they're about to read.

features.name: Traditional Owner Attribution
features.description: Organizations can specify their Traditional Country, and this attribution flows through to displayed stories.

data_sovereignty.headline: Indigenous Data Sovereignty in Practice

principles.implementation: Stories belong to storytellers, not platforms. JusticeHub displays but doesn't own.
All consent is managed in Empathy Ledger. Changes propagate automatically.
Stories carry their cultural context‚Äîorganization, country, protocols‚Äîwherever they're displayed.
Storytellers can remove their content from JusticeHub at any time by changing consent in Empathy Ledger.

data_sovereignty.not_appropriation: JusticeHub never rewrites, summarizes, or recontextualizes community stories. They appear as shared, with full attribution.

for_storytellers: Share your story in Empathy Ledger through your organization
Choose your privacy level (private, community, or public)
If public, your story may appear in JusticeHub's Community Voices section
Change your mind? Update your privacy setting anytime
for_organizations: Enable Empathy Ledger integration for your organization
Set cultural protocols that apply to your community's stories
Manage Elder approval workflows for sensitive content
Stories with indigenous_controlled flag carry special protections
for_justicehub_readers: Browse Community Voices to read stories shared by permission
See cultural warnings before sensitive content
Understand the source organization and cultural context
Know that every story you read was explicitly shared
